page.title: 04Little Cornard Part 2
page.content: The O.S. map shows a large number of small farms, but it seems that many of these have become amalgamated today. De Greys Farm is typical for this area. It has been owned by the same family since 1905. It consists of 500 acres overall and has, within this, 20 acres of woodland. The farmer employs four men and grows crops such as wheat,(140 acres) barley, (120 acres) oats,(10 acres) tick beans,(55acres) and rape,(38 acres). In addition, there are several fruit orchards, a herb and wild-flower farm and a mushroom farm. Finally, another farm boasts one of the few herds of Jersey cows to be found in this part of the country.
